content.description: Sit start matched on a generous edge. From there, bump up to another edge, stand up tall to a pair of sloper-edges, gain the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. There is a nasty rock in the landing.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's south face.

content.description:
Psychosphere climbs a slight overhang on solid micro-edges over a very good landing.

Sit start with hands crossed, a right hand hortizontal incut crimp, a left hand incut gaston, and a right heel hook. From there, crank up to a right hand crimp, match a left hand next to it, gain a left hand edge, then the large shelf, bring up the feet, reach the lip and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two will work well. The landing is good, but there is a rock just left of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the southern section of Guidance's east face.

content.description:
Muted Motion climbs a blunt, undercut arete on beautiful sloper-edges. It's a small, short one, but the movement is worth the experience.

Sit start with a sloping left hand bump and a right hand sloper with a hint of edge. From there,  make a big pull to a sloping left hand edge, match/replace the left with a right hand, then make an awkward move for the lip, mantle, and top it out.
content.protection: At least a pad, as there are a few rocks in the immediate fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the blunt, southwest arete of Guidance Block.

content.description:
Sit start below the arete with a left hand bump, a right hand pocket, and a right heel hook. From there, bump up through the good edges, work out with a right hand to the arete, and continue straight up the remaining arete for a mantle finish.

Getting a foot onto the face with the early moves gives the problem its difficulty, the rest is pretty straightforward.
content.protection: A pad or two will work, the immediate landing is great, but there is a tree behind the problem and rocks on each side of the landing.
content.location: It climbs the southwest side of the south arete on Guidance Block.

content.description:
Defilement climbs an undercut vertical face on good edges over a perfect landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the large hueco's sidepull. From there, pull up to a right hand edge, follow with a left hand gaston to the incut diamond, stem the feet high, hit a set of edges, then work the remaining edges for a solid topout.
content.protection: A pad will do it, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs in between the two huecos on the east face of Guidance.
